qas.question: What NFL team played at the Yale Bowl from 1973-1974?
In what year was the New Haven Arena demolished?
At what currently defunct New Haven venues did minor league hockey and baseball teams play throughout the latter half of the 20th century?

answers.text: New Haven Arena (built in 1926, demolished in 1972), New Haven Coliseum (1972–2002)

qas.question: In what year was Yale field established in New Haven?
The city of New Haven has been known for it various sport teams for how long?
What famous NFL team played in New Haven own stadium in the 70s?
The city has couple of sport stadium which one of them was torn down in 20th century?
In modern day which of the stadiums have continue to host minor sport leagues?
How long has  Yale Field been open and active?

context: New Haven has a history of professional sports franchises dating back to the <a4_0>19th century<a4_0/> and has been the home to professional baseball, basketball, football, hockey, and soccer teams—including the <a0_0><a5_0>New York Giants<a5_0/><a0_0/> of the National Football League from 1973 to 1974, who played at the Yale Bowl. Throughout the second half of the 20th century, New Haven consistently had minor league hockey and baseball teams, which played at the <a2_0><a6_0>New Haven Arena<a6_0/> (built in 1926, demolished in <a1_0>1972<a1_0/>), New Haven Coliseum (1972–2002)<a2_0/>, and <a7_0>Yale Field<a7_0/> (<a3_0><a8_0>1928<a3_0/>–present<a8_0/>).
